There is a difference between the 'legitimate' smurfs and the ones created to be toxic/smash new players etc. The key difference being the latter is reportable and bannable. If they are just doing well then that isn't reportable, as Riot has no problems with smurfs themselves, however if they are trolling/toxic or intentionally losing games please do report them and give details.

'Legitimate' smurfs are those that say, want a second account to completely reset their rank, or want the experience of levelling up with a different role to main (as switching to a role you are very inexperienced with when you are high rank and have a high normal mmr can be VERY difficult). They can be for people who want to play with lower level friends without said friends vsing super high level/rank people etc etc.

Illegitimate smurfs are essentially smurfs created for any malicious reason. If the smurf exists to troll B5 or to 'n00b stomp' or as a way to be toxic without getting banned on their main then they are reportable and bannable.

This isn't a catch all, but generally speaking, if they are trolling and being an ass, report them. New accounts are punished much faster than older accounts.
